page.title: 19GODLEY
page.content: The township of Godley is not mentioned in the original Domesday survey. A collection of undated "Godley Deeds" supply the family name of" de Godele", deriving its name from the name of the township. in the reign of King John. The area surrounding the area is remarkable for its varied scenery of hills, dales , woods and rivers. The woods are mainly made up of ash and oak trees. However the area also comprises of good , rich farm land, meadows and cultivated acres. The parish of Godley and Newton Cross so came into being with the consecration of St. John's Church on 11th of August 1859. Godley is always associated with Hyde, but it was not until 1881 that it was incorporated into its Borough/
